newsitem.title: USA: Lice remedy leaves Iowa girl in critical condition.
newsitem.headline: Lice remedy leaves Iowa girl in critical condition.

text.p: Gasoline fumes that spread when a mother used the fuel to treat her daughter's head lice were accidentally ignited, seriously burning the girl, officials at a Des Moines hospital said on Monday.
Terry Adams, 13, was in Iowa Methodist Hospital in serious condition after Saturday's accident. Her parents, Carol and David Brobst of Lorimor, Iowa, were in fair condition.
A pilot light on a water heater apparently set off the gasoline fumes. The mother said she had used the home remedy successfully on a previous occasion.
